Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a woman in naturalistic style. Mould-made from a two-piece mould and hollow. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica and sand inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Firsty century BC parallel (Bayer Niemeier 1988, no.15). Bayer Niemeier , E. 1988, Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann / Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik Frankfurt am Main I. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten, Melsungen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.444) (Phase 3)
